title: Ticket #4436: condor_collector start up failure with "use role: personal"
description: I discovered this on ingwe where zach has collector on 9618. Before specifying a non-standard port, my clients could not talk to his collector. I believe when I specified a non standard port my negotiator was not usable. I'll recheck that.
remarks:
with use role : personal in play, condor_host is 127.0.0.1 and condor_collector is 127.0.0.1 and this is what master says as coming up: 

Master restart (GRACEFUL) is watching /scratch/bt/outoftree/release_dir/sbin/condor_master (mtime:1404146791)
07/02/14 11:03:11 Warning: attempting to compare null hostnames in same_host.
07/02/14 11:03:11 Collector port not defined, will use default: 9618
07/02/14 11:03:11 Sock::bind failed: errno = 98 Address already in use
07/02/14 11:03:11 Failed to listen(9618) on TCP/IPv4 command socket. Does this computer have IPv4 support?
07/02/14 11:03:11 Warning: Failed to create IPv4 command socket.
07/02/14 11:03:11 ERROR: Create_Process failed trying to start /scratch/bt/outoftree/release_dir/sbin/condor_collector
07/02/14 11:03:11 restarting /scratch/bt/outoftree/release_dir/sbin/condor_collector in 10 seconds

When setting without the role to have all daemons, a condor_host as 127.0.0.1 and collector_host = $condor_host:0 we get the same badness. 

 Warning: attempting to compare null hostnames in same_host.
07/02/14 11:23:39 Collector port not defined, will use default: 9618
07/02/14 11:23:39 Sock::bind failed: errno = 98 Address already in use
07/02/14 11:23:39 Failed to listen(9618) on TCP/IPv4 command socket. Does this computer have IPv4 support?
07/02/14 11:23:39 Warning: Failed to create IPv4 command socket.
07/02/14 11:23:39 ERROR: Create_Process failed trying to start /scratch/bt/outoftree/release_dir/sbin/condor_collector
07/02/14 11:23:39 restarting /scratch/bt/outoftree/release_dir/sbin/condor_collector in 10 seconds

However if the condor_host has a name: CONDOR_HOST = ingwe.cs.wisc.edu the world is happy and all the daemons come up. 

Master restart (GRACEFUL) is watching /scratch/bt/outoftree/release_dir/sbin/condor_master (mtime:1404146791)
07/02/14 11:28:19 Started DaemonCore process "/scratch/bt/outoftree/release_dir/sbin/condor_collector", pid and pgroup = 10534
07/02/14 11:28:19 Waiting for /scratch/bt/outoftree/release_dir/local.ingwe/log/.collector_address to appear.
07/02/14 11:28:20 Found /scratch/bt/outoftree/release_dir/local.ingwe/log/.collector_address.

2014-Jul-08 16:16:43 by adesmet:
with use role : personal in play, condor_host is 127.0.0.1 and condor_collector is 127.0.0.1 - Appears to be a conflict over port 9618; I believe working as expected.

When setting without the role to have all daemons, a condor_host as 127.0.0.1 and collector_host = $condor_host:0 we get the same badness. - Despite the request for port 0 ("grab an arbitrary available port "), tries for 9618 anyone. Wrong behavior.

My own testing (all addresses refer to the machine the configuration was running on.)

COLLECTOR_HOST=127.0.0.1 - Works as expected on port 9618.

COLLECTOR_HOST=puffin.cs.wisc.edu:0 - Works as expected on arbitrary port.

COLLECTOR_HOST=128.105.14.138:0 - Works as expected on arbitrary port.

COLLECTOR_HOST=127.0.0.1:0 - Erroneously tries to use port 9618 

Warning: attempting to compare null hostnames in same_host.
Collector port not defined, will use default: 9618

COLLECTOR_HOST=localhost:0 - Erroneously tries to use port 9618 

Collector port not defined, will use default: 9618

2014-Jul-08 16:59:35 by adesmet:
Closing this ticket. The two issues I believe this identifies have their own tickets:

  • #4451: compare null hostnames in same_host COLLECTOR_HOST 127.0.0.1
  • #4452: Collector port not defined, will use default: 9618 localhost 127.0.0.1
creator: bt
